meanings.definition: The worship or adoration due to God alone.
meanings.sent1: In our church, we offer latria to God during our prayers.
meanings.sent2: The priest led the congregation in latria during the Sunday service.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when their teacher jokingly asked if they were ready to give latria to their homework.
meanings.sent4: The latria of the faithful filled the cathedral with a sense of peace and reverence.
meanings.sent5: The latria of the believers echoed through the halls, a solemn melody of devotion.

meanings.definition: The highest form of worship in the Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: During the special ceremony, the Pope bestowed latria upon the sacred relic.
meanings.sent2: The nuns dedicated their lives to the practice of latria within the convent.
meanings.sent3: The priest's latria for his vintage car collection was a running joke among the parishioners.
meanings.sent4: The latria shown to the saints was a testament to the deep faith of the community.
meanings.sent5: The latria of the faithful was a beacon of light in the darkness of doubt and despair.
